questions.question: What is a common reason for a computer to slow down over time?
questions.description: Temporary files can build up on a computer over time, taking up space and slowing down performance.

questions.question: Which of these can help improve a computer's speed?
questions.description: Adding RAM, removing unused applications, and using an SSD are effective ways to improve performance.

questions.question: Which component is most likely to cause lag when running multiple applications?
questions.description: RAM is a key component for multitasking. Low RAM can cause lag when multiple applications are open.

questions.question: What should be done to prevent malware from slowing down your computer?
questions.description: Antivirus software and safe browsing habits help prevent malware that can slow down a computer.

questions.question: Which part upgrade typically gives the biggest boost to computer speed for everyday tasks?
questions.description: Switching from a hard drive to an SSD generally offers significant speed improvements for daily tasks.

questions.question: Which of these actions can help reduce startup time?
options: Using a faster hard drive or SSD
questions.description: Disabling unnecessary startup applications and using an SSD can significantly reduce startup time.

questions.question: What does defragmenting a hard drive do?
questions.description: Defragmenting a hard drive organizes data, making it quicker for the system to access files.

questions.question: Which tasks can free up space on your computer?
questions.description: Deleting temporary files, uninstalling unused applications, and clearing the recycle bin help free up space.
